result.markdown:
--- title: "Complete factorial designs" --- ## Content - Benefits of factorial designs - Interactions - Simple, marginal and interaction contrasts ## Learning objectives At the end of the session, students should be capable of - listing the benefits of factorial designs - interpreting an interaction plot and being aware of it's limitation - interpreting model effects in sum-to-zero parametrization - reporting results from a two-way analysis of variance - determining whether or not simple or main effects are most suitable ## Readings - {{< fa book >}} [Chapter 4](https://stat.ethz.ch/~meier/teaching/anova/factorial-treatment-structure.html) of @Meier:2022 - {{< fa book >}} [Chapter 5](https://lbelzile.github.io/math80667a/05-interactions_multiway.html) of the course notes ## Complementary readings - {{< fa book >}} Chapter 7 of @Maxwell.Delaney.Kelley:2017. - {{< fa book >}} Chapters 10-13 of @Keppel/Wickens:2004. ## Slides

View all slides in new window Download PDF of all slides

``` ::: ::: :::{.callout-tip} **Fun fact**: If you type ? (or shift + /) while going through the slides, you can see a list of slide-specific commands. ::: ## Code - [R script](/content/MATH80667A-05-content.R) - [SPSS script](/content/MATH80667A-05-content.sps) ## References
